item.title: [PHP] Help Please
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

For information on global variables, look at http://us2.php.net/global

For new lines you can just do:

echo 'You hit the enemy for '. $damage . '<br />';

Yes, it will work.

I have written and tested a source for you, heres a sample and the source:

http://www.chatshack.us/battle.php

[code]

<?php srand((double)microtime()*1000000);

$damage=rand(0,50);
$edamage=rand (0,50);

$hp=75;
$ehp=75;

function fight()
{

global $damage, $edamage, $hp, $ehp;

$damage=rand(0,50);
$edamage=rand (0,50);

echo 'You hit the enemy for '. $damage . ‘
’;
$ehp = $ehp - $damage;
echo 'Enemy HP: ’ . $ehp . ‘

’;

echo 'Enemy hits you for ’ . $edamage . ‘
’;
$hp = $hp - $edamage;
echo 'Your HP: ’ . $hp . ‘

’;

}

while(($hp>1) && ($ehp>1))
{
fight();
}

if (($hp>=1) && ($ehp<=0))
echo ‘You win’;
if (($hp<=0) && ($ehp>=1))
echo ‘You lose’;
if (($hp<=0) && ($ehp<=0))
echo ‘Draw’;
?>

[/code]
